member.summary: Scalar random walk.

member.name: M:PloobsEngine.Utils.MathUtils.BlendIntoAccumulator(System.Single,System.Single,System.Single@)
member.summary: blends new values into an accumulator to produce a smoothed time series
member.remarks: Modifies its third argument, a reference to the float accumulator holding the "smoothed time series." The first argument (smoothRate) is typically made proportional to "dt" the simulation time step. If smoothRate is 0 the accumulator will not change, if smoothRate is 1 the accumulator will be set to the new value with no smoothing. Useful values are "near zero".

member.name: M:PloobsEngine.Utils.MathUtils.BlendIntoAccumulator(System.Single,Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Vector3,Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Vector3@)
member.summary: Blends the parameter into the accumulator.

member.summary: Constructs a new horizontal motion constraint.
member.param: Character to be governed by this constraint.

member.summary: Computes per-frame information necessary for the constraint.

member.summary: Performs any per-frame initialization needed by the constraint that must be done with exclusive access to the connected objects.

member.summary: Computes a solution to the constraint.
member.returns: Impulse magnitude computed by the iteration.

member.name: P:BEPUphysicsDemos.AlternateMovement.SphereCharacter.HorizontalMotionConstraint.SupportData
member.summary: Gets or sets the support data used by the constraint.

member.name: P:BEPUphysicsDemos.AlternateMovement.SphereCharacter.HorizontalMotionConstraint.MovementDirection
member.summary: Gets or sets the goal movement direction.

member.name: P:BEPUphysicsDemos.AlternateMovement.SphereCharacter.HorizontalMotionConstraint.Speed
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum speed at which the character can move while standing with a support that provides traction. Relative velocities with a greater magnitude will be decelerated.

member.name: P:BEPUphysicsDemos.AlternateMovement.SphereCharacter.HorizontalMotionConstraint.SlidingSpeed
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum speed at which the character can move while on a support that does not provide traction. Relative velocities with a greater magnitude will be decelerated.

member.name: P:BEPUphysicsDemos.AlternateMovement.SphereCharacter.HorizontalMotionConstraint.AirSpeed
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum speed at which the character can move with no support. The character will not be decelerated while airborne.

member.name: P:BEPUphysicsDemos.AlternateMovement.SphereCharacter.HorizontalMotionConstraint.MaximumForce
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum force that the character can apply while on a support which provides traction.

member.name: P:BEPUphysicsDemos.AlternateMovement.SphereCharacter.HorizontalMotionConstraint.MaximumSlidingForce
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum force that the character can apply while on a support which does not provide traction.

member.name: P:BEPUphysicsDemos.AlternateMovement.SphereCharacter.HorizontalMotionConstraint.MaximumAirForce
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum force that the character can apply with no support.

member.name: P:BEPUphysicsDemos.AlternateMovement.SphereCharacter.HorizontalMotionConstraint.SupportForceFactor
member.summary: Gets or sets the scaling factor of forces applied to the supporting object if it is a dynamic entity. Low values (below 1) reduce the amount of motion imparted to the support object; it acts 'heavier' as far as horizontal motion is concerned. High values (above 1) increase the force applied to support objects, making them appear lighter. Be careful when changing this- it can create impossible situations! Imagine the character standing on a compound object. If the support force factor is less than 1, then the character can push the compound around while standing on it!

member.name: P:BEPUphysicsDemos.AlternateMovement.SphereCharacter.HorizontalMotionConstraint.MovementMode
member.summary: Gets the movement mode that the character is currently in.

member.name: P:BEPUphysicsDemos.AlternateMovement.SphereCharacter.HorizontalMotionConstraint.RelativeVelocity
member.summary: Gets the current velocity between the character and its support in constraint space. The X component corresponds to velocity along the movement direction. The Y component corresponds to velocity perpendicular to the movement direction and support normal.

member.name: P:BEPUphysicsDemos.AlternateMovement.SphereCharacter.HorizontalMotionConstraint.RelativeWorldVelocity
member.summary: Gets the current velocity between the character and its support.

member.name: T:Bnoerj.AI.Steering.ILocalSpace
member.summary:
A local coordinate system for 3d space
Provides functionality such as transforming from local space to global space and vice versa. Also regenerates a valid space from a perturbed "forward vector" which is the basis of abnstract vehicle turning.
These are comparable to a 4x4 homogeneous transformation matrix where the 3x3 (R) portion is constrained to be a pure rotation (no shear or scale). The rows of the 3x3 R matrix are the basis vectors of the space. They are all constrained to be mutually perpendicular and of unit length. The top ("x") row is called "side", the middle ("y") row is called "up" and the bottom ("z") row is called forward. The translation vector is called "position". Finally the "homogeneous column" is always [0 0 0 1].
[ R R R 0 ] [ Sx Sy Sz 0 ] [ R R R 0 ] [ Ux Uy Uz 0 ] [ R R R 0 ] -> [ Fx Fy Fz 0 ] [ ] [ ] [ T T T 1 ] [ Tx Ty Tz 1 ]

member.summary: Transforms a direction in global space to its equivalent in local space.

member.returns: The global space direction transformed to local space .

member.summary: Transforms a point in global space to its equivalent in local space.

member.returns: The global space position transformed to local space.

member.name: F:PloobsEngine.Engine.InitialEngineDescription.GraphicsProfile
member.summary:
Identifies the set of supported devices for the game based on device capabilities.
Parameters: HiDef: Use the largest available set of graphic features and capabilities to target devices, such as an Xbox 360 console and a Windows-based computer, that have more enhanced graphic capabilities.
Reach: Use a limited set of graphic features and capabilities, allowing the game to support the widest variety of devices, including all Windows-based computers and Windows Phone.

member.name: T:PloobsEngine.IA.NeuralNetwork.BackPropagationLearningAlgorithm
member.summary: Implementation of stockastic gradient backpropagation learning algorithm
member.remarks:
PROPAGATION WAY IN NN ------------------------->
o ----- Sj = f(WSj) ----> o ----- Si = f(WSi) ----> o Neuron j Neuron i Neuron k (layer L-1) (layer L) (layer L+1)
For the neuron i : ------------------- W[i,j](n+1) = W[i,j](n) + alpha * Ai * Sj + gamma * ( W[i,j](n) - W[i,j](n-1) ) T[i](n+1) = T[i](n) - alpha * Ai + gamma * ( T[i](n) - T[i](n-1) )
with : Ai = f'(WSi) * (expected_output_i - si) for output layer Ai = f'(WSi) * SUM( Ak * W[k,i] ) for others
NOTE : This is stockastic version of the algorithm because the error is back-propaged after every learning case. There is another version of this algorithm which works on global error.

member.summary: the alpha parameter of the algorithm

member.summary: the gamma parameter of the algorithm

member.summary: The error vector

member.summary: Build a new BackPropagation learning algorithm instance with alpha = 0,5 and gamma = 0,3

member.name: T:PloobsEngine.IA.NeuralNetwork.GeneticLearningAlgorithm
member.summary: A genetic learning algorithm
member.remarks:
This is an aplication of genetic algorithm to train neural networks. The population is made of GeneticNeuralNetwork instance which is a compact representation of neural network. A genetic neural network represent a set of weights and threshold for a particular neural network.
Here is the main loop of the algorithm :
Create initial random population of POPULATION_SIZE neural networks -> Evaluate fitness function (square error on learning values) | Select best neural networks | Cross selected networks to make new generation -- apply mutation operator on new generation Until error > error_threshold

member.summary: The mutation ratio during crossover

member.summary: Gets or sets the scaling factor of forces applied to the supporting object if it is a dynamic entity. Low values (below 1) reduce the amount of motion imparted to the support object; it acts 'heavier' as far as horizontal motion is concerned. High values (above 1) increase the force applied to support objects, making them appear lighter.

member.name: M:PloobsEngine.Physics.BepuPhysicWorld.ApplyDefaultSettings(PloobsEngine.Physics.BepuPhysicWorld)
member.summary: Applies the default settings to the space. These values are what the engine starts with; they don't have to be applied unless you just want to get back to the defaults. This doesn't cover every single tunable field in the entire engine, just the main ones that this helper class is messing with.

member.name: M:PloobsEngine.Physics.BepuPhysicWorld.ApplyRotationSettings
member.summary: Applies some rotation-related settings. With these settings enabled, rotation generally behaves better with long shapes. Angular motion is more realistic since the momentum is conserved. However, these settings can also cause some instability to sneak into the simulation. Try using these settings on the Saw Contraption demo to see an example of what can go wrong when conservation is enabled.

member.name: M:PloobsEngine.Physics.BepuPhysicWorld.ApplySemiSpeedySettings
member.summary: Applies slightly higher speed settings. The only change here is the default minimum iterations. In many simulations, having a minimum iteration count of 0 works just fine. It's a quick and still fairly robust way to get some extra performance. An example of where this might introduce some issues is sphere stacking.

member.name: M:PloobsEngine.Physics.BepuPhysicWorld.ApplySuperSpeedySettings(PloobsEngine.Physics.BepuPhysicWorld)
member.summary: Applies some low quality, high speed settings. The main benefit comes from the very low iteration cap. By enabling simplex caching, general convex collision detection gets a nice chunk faster, but some curved shapes lose collision detection robustness.

member.name: M:PloobsEngine.Physics.BepuPhysicWorld.ApplyMediumHighStabilitySettings(PloobsEngine.Physics.BepuPhysicWorld)
member.summary: Applies some higher quality settings. By using universal continuous collision detection, missed collisions will be much, much rarer. This actually doesn't have a huge performance cost. The increased iterations put this as a midpoint between the normal and high stability settings.

member.name: M:PloobsEngine.Physics.BepuPhysicWorld.ApplyHighStabilitySettings(PloobsEngine.Physics.BepuPhysicWorld)
member.summary: Applies some high quality, low performance settings. By using universal continuous collision detection, missed collisions will be much, much rarer. This actually doesn't have a huge performance cost. However, increasing the iteration limit and the minimum iterations to 5x the default will incur a pretty hefty overhead. On the upside, pretty much every simulation will be rock-solid.

member.name: T:PloobsEngine.IA.NeuralNetwork.SigmoidActivationFunction
member.summary: The sigmoid activation function
member.remarks:
Here is the definition of the sigmoid activation function
1 f(x) = ----------------- beta > 0 1 + e^(-beta*x)
f'(x) = beta * f(x) * ( 1 - f(x) )

member.name: T:PloobsEngine.IA.NeuralNetwork.GaussianActivationFunction
member.summary: The gaussian activation function
member.remarks:
1 -(x-mu)^2 / (2 * sigma^2) f(x) = -------------------- * e sqrt(2 * pi * sigma)
f'(x) = y(x) * -2*K*(x - mu)
To implement a more efficient computation :
C = 1/sqrt(2 * pi * sigma) K = 1/(2 * sigma^2)

member.summary: Creates a new pool with a specific starting size.

Whether or not the pool is allowed to increase its size as needed.
A predicate used to determine if a given object is still valid.
A function used to allocate an instance for the pool.

member.summary: Cleans up the pool by checking each valid object to ensure it is still actually valid.

member.summary: Returns a new object from the Pool.
member.returns: The next object in the pool if available, null if all instances are valid.

member.summary: Gets or sets a delegate used for initializing objects before returning them from the New method.

member.name: P:PloobsEngine.DataStructure.Pool`1.Deinitialize
member.summary: Gets or sets a delegate that is run when an object is moved from being valid to invalid in the CleanUp method.

member.summary: Gets the number of valid objects in the pool.

member.name: T:Bnoerj.AI.Steering.PolylinePathway
member.summary: PolylinePathway: a simple implementation of the Pathway protocol. The path is a "polyline" a series of line segments between specified points. A radius defines a volume for the path which is the union of a sphere at each point and a cylinder along each segment.

member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum force that the constraint will apply in attempting to keep the character stuck to the ground.

member.name: P:BEPUphysicsDemos.AlternateMovement.SphereCharacter.VerticalMotionConstraint.SupportForceFactor
member.summary: Gets or sets the scaling factor of forces applied to the supporting object if it is a dynamic entity. Low values (below 1) reduce the amount of motion imparted to the support object; it acts 'heavier' as far as horizontal motion is concerned. High values (above 1) increase the force applied to support objects, making them appear lighter.

member.summary: Gets the effective mass felt by the constraint.

member.summary: Gets the relative velocity between the character and its support along the support normal.

member.name: F:BEPUphysicsDemos.AlternateMovement.Character.CharacterController.ConstraintAccessLocker
member.summary: This is used to control the access to simulation islands when there are multiple character controllers updating in parallel. If other parts of the program are modifying simulation islands during the IBeforeSolverUpdateable.Update stage, the synchronization umbrella will need to be widened.

member.summary: Jumps the character off of whatever it's currently standing on. If it has traction, it will go straight up. If it doesn't have traction, but is still supported by something, it will jump in the direction of the surface normal.

member.summary: This is used to control the access to simulation islands when there are multiple character controllers updating in parallel. If other parts of the program are modifying simulation islands during the IBeforeSolverUpdateable.Update stage, the synchronization umbrella will need to be widened.

member.summary: In some cases, an applied velocity should only modify the character. This allows partially non-physical behaviors, like gluing the character to the ground.
member.param: Change to apply to the character.

member.name: M:BEPUphysicsDemos.AlternateMovement.SphereCharacter.SphereCharacterController.Jump
member.summary: Jumps the character off of whatever it's currently standing on. If it has traction, it will go straight up. If it doesn't have traction, but is still supported by something, it will jump in the direction of the surface normal.

member.summary: Gets the physical body of the character.

member.name: P:BEPUphysicsDemos.AlternateMovement.SphereCharacter.SphereCharacterController.HorizontalMotionConstraint
member.summary: Gets the constraint used by the character to handle horizontal motion. This includes acceleration due to player input and deceleration when the relative velocity between the support and the character exceeds specified maximums.

member.name: P:BEPUphysicsDemos.AlternateMovement.SphereCharacter.SphereCharacterController.VerticalMotionConstraint
member.summary: Gets the constraint used by the character to stay glued to surfaces it stands on.

member.summary: Gets or sets the amount of force to apply to supporting dynamic entities as a fraction of the force used to reach the jump speed.

member.summary: Gets the support finder used by the character. The support finder analyzes the character's contacts to see if any of them provide support and/or traction.

member.summary: Checks to see if a character is capable of stepping up or down onto a new support object.

member.summary: Constructs a new step manager for a character.

member.name: M:BEPUphysicsDemos.AlternateMovement.Character.StepManager.TryToStepDown(Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Vector3@)
member.summary: Determines if a down step is possible, and if so, computes the location to which the character should teleport.
member.param: New position the character should teleport to if the down step is accepted.
member.returns: Whether or not the character should attempt to step down.

member.name: M:BEPUphysicsDemos.AlternateMovement.Character.StepManager.TryToStepUp(Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Vector3@)
member.summary: Determines if an up step is possible, and if so, computes the location to which the character should teleport.
member.param: New position the character should teleport to if the up step is accepted.
member.returns: Whether or not the character should attempt to step up.

member.name: P:BEPUphysicsDemos.AlternateMovement.Character.StepManager.MaximumStepHeight
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum height which the character is capable of stepping up or down onto.

member.name: P:BEPUphysicsDemos.AlternateMovement.Character.StepManager.MinimumDownStepHeight
member.summary: Gets or sets the minimum down step height. Down steps which are smaller than this are simply ignored by the step system; instead, the character falls. If the new step location has traction, the intermediate falling will not remove traction from the character. The only difference is that the character isn't teleported down when the step is too small.

member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum speed at which the character can move while standing with a support that provides traction. Relative velocities with a greater magnitude will be decelerated.

member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum speed at which the character can move while crouching with a support that provides traction. Relative velocities with a greater magnitude will be decelerated.

member.name: P:BEPUphysicsDemos.AlternateMovement.Character.HorizontalMotionConstraint.SlidingSpeed
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum speed at which the character can move while on a support that does not provide traction. Relative velocities with a greater magnitude will be decelerated.

member.name: P:BEPUphysicsDemos.AlternateMovement.Character.HorizontalMotionConstraint.AirSpeed
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum speed at which the character can move with no support. The character will not be decelerated while airborne.

member.name: P:BEPUphysicsDemos.AlternateMovement.Character.HorizontalMotionConstraint.MaximumForce
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum force that the character can apply while on a support which provides traction.

member.name: P:BEPUphysicsDemos.AlternateMovement.Character.HorizontalMotionConstraint.MaximumSlidingForce
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum force that the character can apply while on a support which does not provide traction.

member.name: P:BEPUphysicsDemos.AlternateMovement.Character.HorizontalMotionConstraint.MaximumAirForce
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum force that the character can apply with no support.

member.name: P:BEPUphysicsDemos.AlternateMovement.Character.HorizontalMotionConstraint.SupportForceFactor
member.summary: Gets or sets the scaling factor of forces applied to the supporting object if it is a dynamic entity. Low values (below 1) reduce the amount of motion imparted to the support object; it acts 'heavier' as far as horizontal motion is concerned. High values (above 1) increase the force applied to support objects, making them appear lighter. Be careful when changing this- it can create impossible situations! Imagine the character standing on a compound object. If the support force factor is less than 1, then the character can push the compound around while standing on it!

member.name: P:BEPUphysicsDemos.AlternateMovement.Character.HorizontalMotionConstraint.MovementMode
member.summary: Gets the movement mode that the character is currently in.

member.name: P:BEPUphysicsDemos.AlternateMovement.Character.HorizontalMotionConstraint.RelativeVelocity
member.summary: Gets the current velocity between the character and its support in constraint space. The X component corresponds to velocity along the movement direction. The Y component corresponds to velocity perpendicular to the movement direction and support normal.

member.name: P:BEPUphysicsDemos.AlternateMovement.Character.HorizontalMotionConstraint.RelativeWorldVelocity
member.summary: Gets the current velocity between the character and its support.

member.name: T:PloobsEngine.IA.NeuralNetwork.NeuralNetwork
member.summary: Implementation of artificial neural network
member.remarks:
o o o o INPUT VECTOR =====> o o o =====> OUTPUT VECTOR o o o o NERON LAYERS
Each neuron of the layer N-1 is conected to every neuron of the layer N. At the begining the neural network needs to learn using couples (INPUT, EXPECTED OUTPUT) and a learnig algorithm.

member.summary: Layers of neuron in the network

member.summary: Number of inputs of the network (number of inputs of the first layer)

member.summary: Learning algorithm used by the network

member.name: M:PloobsEngine.IA.NeuralNetwork.NeuralNetwork.#ctor(System.Int32,System.Int32[],PloobsEngine.IA.NeuralNetwork.ActivationFunction,PloobsEngine.IA.NeuralNetwork.LearningAlgorithm)
member.summary: Create a new neural network with "inputs" inputs and size of "layers" layers of neurones. The layer i is made with layers_desc[i] neurones. The activation function of each neuron is set to n_act. The lerning algorithm is set to learn.
member.param: Number of inputs of the network
Number of neurons for each layer of the network
Activation function for each neuron in the network
Learning algorithm to be used by the neural network

member.name: M:PloobsEngine.IA.NeuralNetwork.NeuralNetwork.#ctor(System.Int32,System.Int32[],PloobsEngine.IA.NeuralNetwork.ActivationFunction)
member.summary: Create a new neural network with "inputs" inputs and size of "layers" layers of neurones. The layer i is made with layers_desc[i] neurones. The activation function of each neuron is set to n_act. The lerning algorithm is set to default (Back Propagation).
member.param: Number of inputs of the network
Number of neurons for each layer of the network
Activation function for each neuron in the network

member.name: M:PloobsEngine.IA.NeuralNetwork.NeuralNetwork.#ctor(System.Int32,System.Int32[])
member.summary: Create a new neural network with "inputs" inputs and size of "layers" layers of neurones. The layer i is made with layers_desc[i] neurones. The activation function of each neuron is set to default (Sigmoid with beta = 1). The lerning algorithm is set to default (Back Propagation).
member.param: Number of inputs of the network
Number of neurons for each layer of the network
